availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Gibson Irwin (Trigg County, Kentucky, planter.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, planter. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Letitia Irwin. Father of George Irwin, Fanny Irwin, John Irwin, Gibson Irwin, Sallie Irwin, and Mattie Irwin. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned forty-seven enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 100.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, pp. 381B-382A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Montgomery County, District 12, p. 397A.
"Francis Gibson Irwin (1827-1894)," Find A Grave, Memorial 52873726, accessed May 18, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52873726.
"Mary Letitia Snadon Irwin (1834-1924)," Find A Grave, Memorial 52873728, accessed May 18, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52873728.
